terms.name: contact affiliation
terms.value: Lab of Neuroproteomics, Institute of Biology, Department of Biochemistry and Tissue Biology, University of Campinas (UNICAMP), Campinas, Brazil.

description: Pluripotent stem  cells (PSC) can differentiate inot any cell type of an organism. Their remarkable capability of self-organization enables the formation of three-dimensional structures that resembles miniature organs, including cerebral organoids. These organoids can recreate early steps of the human cerebral cortex development, and show great potential for modeling human diseases, particularly for those with a developmental component. This data evidences stem cell-derived cerebral organoids as a key model to study brain development and neurodevelopmental, neurodegenerative and neuropsychiatric diseases.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: pluripotent stem cell, cerebral organoids, minibrain, neural, progenitors

terms.name: Reference
terms.value: Nascimento JM, Saia-Cereda VM, Sartore RC, da Costa RM, Schitine CS, Freitas HR, Murgu M, de Melo Reis RA, Rehen SK, Martins-de-Souza D. Human Cerebral Organoids and Fetal Brain Tissue Share Proteomic Similarities. Front Cell Dev Biol. 2019 7:303

title: Cerebral organoids proteomics -  Human Cerebral Organoids and Fetal Brain Tissue Share Proteomic Similarities
